name: Courtyard Amsterdam Airport

reviews.text: First, the not-so-good features: it's not the 5 euros for the shuttle bus that matters. (Why do people complain about such a trivial amount?) It's the very long periods between shuttles that can be a problem if you have a plane to catch. I had no idea that you are supposed to reserve a seat ahead of time, and found out by accident, and managed to catch the 09:45 for an 11:35 flight. God help me if I missed that one! Can't they run them more frequently? (I also waited in the cold for thirty minutes while at the airport for the shuttle to the hotel. In that time two shuttles for the Ibis hotel came.) Breakfast is also 21.50 euros. That is a bit much. That is way out of line, actually. And I couldn't get my room warm. (The heat vent is up high, and hot air rises, so it may have heated the ceiling, but not me. And weirdly, there is a large divider between the heat vent and the bed, preventing any accidentally-warm air from reaching you.)
reviews.title: A nice hotel with annoying little features

reviews.text: And an internet connection costs something like 12.95 euros per 24 hours. If you want four hours, which costs less--thinking that you will not spend more time than that on the internet--beware, because it's four hours from the second you sign on. If you sign off to go to the bar or take a bath, the four hours keeps ticking away. That, I think, is not customer-friendly.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel but a little far from center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and the bar: nice atmosphere except for the very loud, irritating pop music, which ruins the whole experience.
reviews.title: Not an airport hotel, not up to Courtyard by Marriott standards

reviews.text: The good? My room was fairly roomy and comfortable. Except for the chair at the desk. It was not an office chair, so it couldn't be raised or lowered. So I felt like a five year-old at the grownups' dinner table. Not business-friendly.
reviews.title: Comfortable airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice hotel, but with irritating features designed to get (more) money out of you.
reviews.title: Mariott should not lend its name to this deception

reviews.text: I cant recommend this hotel highly enough. I organised a meeting here for a large group of visually impaired people, many of whom were accompanied by guide dogs. The hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful to our group, both in terms of the arrangements for our meeting (which were perfect) and in terms of assistance to those of our meeting participants who needed additional assistance. The meeting rooms were on the ground floor and had excellent natural light, which is always appreciated when so many meeting facilities are in dimly lit basements. The refreshments were great and my only complaint is that they gave us access to far to many chocolate bars, pastries and sweets! The AV equipment we needed worked well and the staff responsible for the meeting areas were always available and managed to sort out any issues we had.
reviews.title: Great hotel with terrific staff

reviews.text: Our meeting was complicated by the fact that it coincided with a very heavy snowfall which closed schiphol and delayed many of our participants and completely prevented others from coming. This placed additional pressure on the hotel staff which they coped with brilliantly. The footpaths and walking areas outside the hotel were cleared of snow very efficiently and almost as soon as the snow stopped falling,
reviews.title: Shuttle bus tries to make up for location.

reviews.text: The bedrooms were large. clean and very comfortable. There was excellent wifi throughout the hotel (free in the public areas)
reviews.title: Great place to stay !

reviews.text: The surroundings of the hotel are great, it is situated in a large park with areas suitable for exercising the guide dogs. I noticed that the hotel also provided bikes - although given that we had to deal with about 40cm of snow, we didnt use them!
reviews.title: Great airport hotel. Only bad thing is the gym.

reviews.text: At the end of our conference, the reception staff were extremely helpful in liaising with the airport to arrange special assistance for those of our departing delegates who needed it, which was very useful. I was also very happy with the airport transfer service the hotel provides, the drivers were helpful and polite to all our delegates.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is best for staying overnight before or after a flight from the airport, as it is far away from the center of Amsterdam and most tourist-type attractions. We generally like Courtyard Inns but have found that in Europe Marriotts are a better value, as more options are available for meals (e.g., Continental breakfast at a lower price vs. "full" breakfast), free internet access is provided in all the rooms, which are very comfortable and usually have complimentary coffee service, and we don't feel "nickel and dimed" like we do at the Courtyards. The Courtyards we have stayed in (Amsterdam, Brussels, Hanover) have not offered free internet connections in the room or lobby, or free parking. Coffee service is generally limited to a machine in the lobby which serves free cups only from 6:00-9:00 a.m., which is not nearly enough hours for diehard coffee drinkers or late risers. Also, the options for breakfast are limited to a buffet which costs 22 Euros per person, which is way too much for the quality of food served and the service provided. Dinner options are better, but the service is generally haphazard and meal prices are a little high. Courtyards usually have nice lounges, have a decent selection of beers and appetizers at fairly reasonable prices, and the bartenders and servers tend to be much more attentive than they are in the restaurant. The rooms in the Courtyards are fine with comfortable beds and flat screen TVs, as well as nice bathrooms. The Courtyard Amsterdam is next door to a "family center" which has a few restaurants, a bowling alley, music and dancing, and a few other activities which will tide most people over until they get to another destination.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I have recently returned from a weekend stay at the courtyard Marriott Amsterdam and I have to say I was bitterly disappointed! Having read reviews on this site I knew the hotel was isolated but as it is situated next to the Claus event centre I thought there would be plenty places to eat for dinner. I was wrong. The hotel restaurant is not open for dinner at weekends, neither too was the bistro at the claus centre open. This left only the salsa restaurant which was ok but very loud and busy. I would not recommend a stay here at the weekend, even the room service menu is limited to pizza and sandwiches. We waited 45 mins for the shuttle bus at Schipol, and decided to get a taxi which cost 35 Euros. The wireless internet access is only free in the hotel lobby area, a charge of 5 Euros an hour is applicable if you'd like to have access in your room and the breakfasts are seriously over priced at 18.50 euros for something significantly substanded. There is also a charge for parking of 13.50 a day. I will say though, that the hotel is clean and the rooms are quite spacious we had two queen beds, but having stayed at the Radisson Schipol airport the weekend before I know which one I shall be returning to.
reviews.title: Isolated at weekends

reviews.text: Every once in a while when I dont have time to stay in a city (which is a shame especially for Amsterdam) then an airport hotel becomes the choice. Although fairly spread out, Schipohl Airport has quite a few convenient hotels. Hoofddorp though (City of the Courtyard) is in the middle of literally no where. It's pretty Dutch countryside and quiet, but even in realitive terms it is close to absolutely nothing.
reviews.title: Far away from anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Courtyard stretches the term "airport location" to the extreme. There is a free shuttle bus..BUT.. be careful of the schedule. If you take the shuttle from the hotel back to Schipohl to catch a train for Centraal Station (Amsterdam) make sure you know what time the last bus picks you up from Schipohl upon your return. On the weeked the last shuttle back is at 11:10 PM (and that's not near late enough for any adventures into Amsterdam and back.) Arrive back to Schipohl later that time and you will either need to figure out the confusing local bus schedule or take a cab that will cost between 25-30Euros. It is a fairly frequent experience that you will arrive to the airport and either have a 45min to 1 hr wait on the next shuttle. When expecting to take the shuttle from the hotel back to the airport be sure to reserve at the front desk in advance. Show up unreserved and you stand a good chance of the bus being full.
reviews.title: Back to old standards

likes.disliked: — Parking difficulties when the party centre next door is busy

reviews.text: The Courtyard is a fine, immaculately clean property with modern rooms (flat panel TVs, sparkling baths, etc) decent restaurant and a good breakfast. I have stayed here several times and each time I promise myself I will make the extra effort to stay in the city or stay at an airport hotel that is closer to Schipohl with more tranpost options to the airport.
reviews.title: Functional and Comfortable

likes.disliked: — Distance from Town, Cost of Food and Beverages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent here 2 nights and everything was alright. Driving directions werent that clear and it took a while to find it. I chose this place because of the brand and the good offer proposed as hotels in the city at the same price were 3 categories below this one. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff was ok. I tried the breakfast as well which was pretty good. A positive experience but it's not easy to get to the city centre without your own transportation.
reviews.title: Acceptable place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Courtyard because we used Marriott points so the price was right. I frequently stay at Courtyards in the US but this one doesn't have the same ambience Marriott is acheiving and I've become use to. Nothing really wrong but It was just an OK stay for us. It was too far from airport and difficult for us to figure out the transportation arrangement being first time guests.
reviews.title: served our purpose

reviews.text: The room was basic, check in flawless, food in restaurant satisfactory. The staff friendly and polite. We experienced what we expected based on other's reviews.
reviews.title: Still an excellent airport hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Consistent, quiet, and well executed. I’ve been bunking here for almost 8 years now, so I’m a very happy return guest.
reviews.title: A nice escape from noise and traffic

reviews.text: This is a very-off-airport hotel, a good 15 minute drive from Schiphol. I’ve bunked at the Hilton, the Crowne Plaza and the Novotel here, and have had numerous meetings at the Sheraton. I can’t afford the Sheraton, and the Hilton was also quite expensive. The Novotel is more swish and modern, but I enjoy the quiet and serenity of the Courtyard.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service .. Really Poor

reviews.text: The hotel's located at Hoofddorp, 5 km from Schiphol airport and 10 km from Amsterdam. I arrived at 7 p.m. and I caught the last transfer bus to the hotel. It's no free, costs 5 or 10 eur one-way, don't remember. Not so good, I assume. As I've understood the hotel has no easy public transport access. Hotel was very good with spacious room with stylish furniture and very comfortable bath (bath + separated shower). Be careful with reception stuff. They were polite, but charged my credit card twice and I had a trouble with return.
reviews.title: Pretty smart but not so good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel since we were driving through Europe and we didn't want to face the nightmare of parking in Amsterdam. The staff was very kind and helpful. The room was quite comfortable. They offer free Internet access at the lobby but parking is paid.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, especially if you are driving

reviews.text: This Courtyard is a 10 minute drive from Schiphol Airport set in a delightful wooded park. The hotel has a warm, upscale ambience with large quiet rooms with elegant appointments, such as marble bathrooms. The fitness center is excellent. Service in the hotel is exceptionally friendly and attentive. For a business traveller, this is an outstanding, relaxing choice.
reviews.title: One of the best Courtyards...anywhere

reviews.text: The hotel was really nice and comfortable but not in the greatest location. They say it is at the airport but that is a gross misrepresentation. They do offer a shuttle from the airport (5 euros per person, each way, added to your hotel tab) and they give very clear instructions on how to use public transportation to get in to the city. If I were to go back to Amsterdam, though, I would definitely stay in a more central location. Location aside, the hotel is very nice, rooms are large and well appointed, and amenities (fitness, sauna, restaurant at hotel) were very good.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, far from everything.

reviews.text: I stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Amsterdam Airport when I have meetings at Schiphol. While it is named 'Amsterdam Airport' it is not right at the airport. It takes around 15 minutes by shuttle bus or car to get to the hotel but on the other hand it is a very quiet location to be in the airport area. The hotel is surrounded by a park which is nice for running or cycling (there are bikes to borrow at the hotel).
reviews.title: Tranquil location, nice rooms and pleasant service
Pretty location, not so close to airport
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for two nights during my first trip to Europe because our friend got a good deal on the rooms, and our friends were leaving from the airport after the stay. The hotel is not that close to Schiphol airport, the shuttle does not run very frequently, and it costs 5€ each way. The shuttle ride takes about 15 minutes, and I think it runs hourly, a bit more often during peak hours. From Schiphol, it's another 10-15 minute train ride to Amsterdam. Luckily the trains are frequent. The hotel is located in a huge green park, so the location is pleasant. There is a convention center nearby, and a large number of tour buses arrived our second day. There is wireless available, which was nice (not common in many of the hotels we stayed at throughout Europe). Our room was clean and had a nice view over the park. But if you are looking for a hotel near the airport, I wouldn't recommend it. Other hotels were much closer, and their shuttles seemed far more frequent.
The hotel is clean, quiet and the staff pleasant and responsive. It is a typical Marriott Courtyard.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: It is ten minutes or so from Schipol Airport.
reviews.title: A good alternative

reviews.text: It is twenty minutes by car to Amsterdam proper.
reviews.title: Nice place in a serene environment
Helpful staff, so-so rooms, pleasant location
reviews.text: Family room has two rooms which is great if traveling with family or friends. Breakfast is expensive as is all the dining.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked an accessible room at this hotel for a one night stay after a cruise before flying to the US. The accessible room was the most complete we'd ever seen. You walked into a bathroom with a double sink counter, bathtub, and separate shower stall. On the other end of the bathroom was a door into an completely accessible bathroom with a roll-in shower and handicap toilet. The staff was polite, everything was sparkling clean, and you could only access the elevators with your room key card. The hotel is adjacent to a large park with excellent walking paths.
reviews.title: Accessible Room But Not At Airport

reviews.text: The hotel is at least 20 minutes drive from the airport and the first shuttle does not leave until 6:05 AM. There are no taxis available nearby. The shuttle driver did his best -- we were the second drop-off but at KLM instead of British Airways. So we had a long walk to get to the proper airline --then another long walk to get to the gate. We almost missed our flight.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet hotel for Amsterdam

reviews.text: So I would suggest using a different hotel if you have a very early morning flight.
reviews.title: Great property, Hated to leave, cannot wait to go back

reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights during a business/vacation trip. The hotel is conveniently located near the Schipol airport (took me less than 10 mins to airport by car) and is not too far from downtown Amsterdam. The rooms are very spacious and modern. The internet service is reliable and has both LAN and wireless available in the rooms. The hotel has a mini-market that is a little expensive, but is nice to have around when you need a quick snack. The fitness room has a couple of treadmills and machine weights, but not much else. The price is reasonable and the staff was friendly. There is no ATM at the hotel, but you can exchange money (only Euros and USD). Next to the hotel is an "event center" that has a few restaurants and a bowling alley, which is nice if you don't want to go far for food. The hotel is surrounded by a park that has a lot of running trails, which makes it a nice, quiet, and serene place to stay. I would definitely stay here again if in the Amsterdam area.
reviews.title: Convenient location & services

reviews.text: I have been visiting this Hotel for over 10 years and it just keeps excelling. Terrific Management and awesome employees. It is amazing how many of the personnel are still working there and they work hard at making your visit special. The area is unbelievably beautiful with all kinds of outdoor things to do. 15 minute shuttle ride from Schipol and you feel like your in the country. Nice lake, jogging tracks, horses working out on the horse track, the beach not mention the Claus facility.
reviews.title: Well-run hotel with an inconvenient shuttle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a penthouse suite with my spouse on a weekend getaway. The room was very nice, especially the in-room "spa" with a jacuzzi. We got a very nice price as it was a weekend. Room was very spacious, and the view from the top floor was nice.
reviews.title: Penthouse suite with jacuzzi

reviews.text: I can well recommend the hotel for romantic getaways. The location is suitable also for airport connections, but inconvenient if the purpose is to visit Amsterdam downtown.
reviews.title: Peace of mind location for a stop over night at Amsterdam Airport

reviews.text: I had a full week working in Germany due a trade show and on my stop over night in Amsterdam for the next day early flight I found this peace of mind location before I take the another 12 hours flight on way home. The hotel has large rooms well equipped with large LCD TV, "wired" Internet (expensive.. about EUR 12,00 a day.. is too much for this simple service) with iron board which is perfect when your are in business. It's just beside of a very nice park with several lakes to walk and jog, It's located on the country along the farms from Schiphol Airport. The hotel has a good mini market and a few meters you can find a convention center with 3 restaurants and more.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Nice Staff, Friendly Managment but not able to credit Reward points!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in that Hotel twice. The location is nice and quite. The little lake is beautyfull to go for Jogging and the Event centre offeres good possibilities if you do not want to go to Amsterdam or Harlem. Really enjoyed the wine tasting with the General Manager.
reviews.title: Very pretty hotel, but very isolated.

reviews.text: The only Problem I faced is that this Hotel is not able to credit your Reward Points. Even not after the second reminder from the first stay or after the second stay. Other Hotels do that immediately. Why does this takes so long???
reviews.title: Strange practise to charge double payments on credit card

description: When staying at this 4-star hotel, you would never imagine you are just 12 minutes from the Airport. Set within a serene park near a beautiful lake, the hotel is in good reach of Amsterdam and Haarlem. The hotel offers first-class spacious rooms that include luxury bedding and free Internet access. After a busy day, take a walk in the park and catch up with friends and colleagues in our onsite restaurant or bar.
